name: EOPS/CARE (Extended Opportunity Programs)
description: Book vouchers, priority registration, counseling, and additional grants for low-income community college students
fullDescription: EOPS provides academic and financial support to low-income community college students, while CARE offers additional support to single parents on public assistance.
whatTheyOffer:
- Priority registration
- Book vouchers and supplies
- Academic counseling
- Transfer assistance
- Grant aid (in addition to other financial aid)
- CARE program: childcare assistance, meal vouchers, additional grants for single parents
howToGetIt:
1. Must be enrolled at California Community College
2. Must meet income eligibility requirements
3. Must be educationally disadvantaged
4. Must enroll in at least 12 units
5. Apply through college EOPS office
6. CARE: must be single parent receiving CalWORKs/TANF
keywords: EOPS, CARE, community college, low-income, academic support, financial aid, book vouchers, counseling, single parent
